Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Steam (ST): "...Certainly, the body cannot last with nothing more than a small breakfast, but..."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Certainly, the body cannot last with nothing more than a small breakfast, but..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……確かに、わずかばかりの朝食では体が持たないが、しかし…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……確かに、わずかばかりの朝食では体が持たないが、しかし…」
Russian (RU): "......Для нормальной работы телу будет мало такого скромного завтрака, но всё же..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Certamente, o corpo não consegue se manter com apenas um pequeno café da manhã, mas..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……的確，光靠這麼一點點早餐，身體是撐不住的，可是…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……的确，光靠这么一点点早餐，身体是撑不住的，可是…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Certamente, il corpo non può resistere con niente più di una piccola colazione, ma..."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "Of course, we understand. Still, as time passes, it'll get darker and darker out. It's probably at its brightest now. It's the most convenient time."
Umineko Project (UP): "Of course, we understand. But the thing is, as time passes, it'll get darker and darker. Now is probably the lightest. Now is the most convenient time."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Of course, we understand. Still, as time passes, it'll get darker and darker. Now is probably the lightest. Now is the most convenient time."
PC Japanese (JP): 「もちろんわかってるさ。だがな、時間を置けばどんどん暗くなってくる。多分、今が一番明るい。今が一番都合がいいんだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「もちろんわかってるさ。だがな、時間を置けばどんどん暗くなってくる。多分、今が一番明るい。今が一番都合がいいんだ」
Russian (RU): "Конечно, мы понимаем. Чем больше времени пройдёт, тем темнее станет. Сейчас светлее всего. Поэтому сейчас самое подходящее время."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É claro, nós entendemos. Mas a questão é que, conforme o tempo passa, vai ficar mais e mais escuro. Provavelmente esta é a hora mais clara. Este é o momento mais conveniente."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這個當然明白了。但是啊，時間越是拖下去，天就會越來越黑。現在多半是天最亮的時候。這會兒去是最合適的啊。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这个当然明白了。但是啊，时间越是拖下去，天就会越来越黑。现在多半是天最亮的时候。这会儿去是最合适的啊。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ovviamente, noi capiamo. Inoltre, come il tempo passa, si fa sempre più scuro. Ora probabilmente c'è più luce. È il momento più conveniente."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "Only about an hour has passed since Rosa-san was attacked. This is simply too reckless...!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Only about an hour has passed since Rosa‐san was attacked. This is simply too reckless...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Only about an hour has passed since Rosa-san was attacked. This is simply too reckless...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「楼座さんたちが襲われてから、まだ１時間も経ったかどうかですよ。いくら何でも無用心です…！」
Russian (RU): "С момента нападения на Розу прошло полчаса. Такой поступок будет чистой воды безрассудством!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Se passou apenas cerca de uma hora desde que a Rosa‐san foi atacada. Isto é simplesmente imprudente demais...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「從樓座妹妹他們遇襲時起到現在，連有沒有過一小時都不知道。再怎麼說，這也太缺乏警惕心了…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「从楼座妹妹他们遇袭时起到现在，连有没有过一小时都不知道。再怎么说，这也太缺乏警惕心了…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "È passata solo un'ora da quando Rosa-san è stata attaccata. È semplicemente troppo sconsiderato...!"

Steam (ST): It was only natural that Natsuhi was yelling about recklessness. ...After all, Rudolf had said he was going to the mansion to get food.
Umineko Project (UP): It was only natural that Natsuhi was yelling about recklessness.{n}...Because Rudolf had said that he was going to the mansion to get food.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was only natural that Natsuhi was yelling about it being reckless....Because Rudolf had said that he was going to the mansion to get food.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃が無用心だと叫ぶのも無理はない。…留弗夫が、屋敷に食料を取りに行くと言い出したからだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 夏妃が無用心だと叫ぶのも無理はない。{n}…留弗夫が、屋敷に食料を取りに行くと言い出したからだ。
Russian (RU): Было не удивительно, что Нацухи кричала о безрассудстве.{n}...Потому что Рудольф заявил, что собирается пойти в особняк раздобыть еды.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era natural que Natsuhi estivesse berrando sobre imprudência.{n}...Porque Rudolf tinha dito que ele estava indo à mansão para pegar comida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 夏妃高喊“太缺乏警惕心了”，也是不無道理的。{n}…因為留弗夫提出，要去趟大屋拿食物。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 夏妃高喊“太缺乏警惕心了”，也是不无道理的。{n}…因为留弗夫提出，要去趟大屋拿食物。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era solo naturale che Natsuhi stesse urlando per quell'azione sconsiderata. ... Dato che Rudolf aveva detto che sarebbe andato alla villa a prendere del cibo.

Steam (ST): Certainly, on top of their fatigue, their hunger was tormenting them.
Umineko Project (UP): Certainly, they were being tormented by hunger as well as their fatigue.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Certainly, thanks to their fatigue, their hunger was tormenting them.
PC Japanese (JP): 確かに彼らは疲労に加え、空腹感にも苛まれていた。
Russian (RU): Из‐за их усталости голод только сильнее мучил их.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Certamente eles estavam sendo atormentados pela fome, bem como pela fadiga.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 確實，除了疲勞，他們也受到了空腹感的折磨。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 确实，除了疲劳，他们也受到了空腹感的折磨。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Certamente, a causa della loro stanchezza, la loro fame li stava tormentando.

Steam (ST): In the beginning, a mild level of hunger had been just what they needed to fight off drowsiness. However, it now just made their minds hazy, since it was still only midday, and their bodies felt like they were reaching their limits.
Umineko Project (UP): In the beginning, they were just fine, because they could fight their moderate hunger with their drowsiness; but now it just made their minds hazy, and even though it was still only midday, their bodies felt like they were reaching their limits.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the beginning, they could fight their hunger just fine because of their drowsiness. However, now it just made their minds hazy, since it was still only midday and their bodies felt like they were reaching their limits.
PC Japanese (JP): 初めの内こそ、ほどよい空腹感は眠気と戦えてちょうど良かったが、今は逆に意識を朦朧とさせ、まだ昼だと言うのに、もう体力の限界を感じさせている。
Russian (RU): Поначалу они могли бороться с чувством голода благодаря их сонливости. Однако теперь их разум начал туманиться, поскольку был ещё только полдень, и они ощущали, что тела на пределе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No início, eles estavam bem, porque conseguiam lutar com sua fome moderada por meio da sonolência; mas agora isso só deixava suas mentes nebulosas, e mesmo que ainda fosse apenas meio‐dia, seus corpos estavam chegando aos seus limites.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然剛開始時，恰到好處的空腹感正好能抑制住睡意，但現在，這反而令他們意識朦朧，明明還是中午，他們的身體似乎就已到了極限。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然刚开始时，恰到好处的空腹感正好能抑制住睡意，但现在，这反而令他们意识朦胧，明明还是中午，他们的身体似乎就已到了极限。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): All'inizio, potevano combatterla a causa della loro sonnolenza. Tuttavia, ora le loro menti si erano annebbiate, dato che era ancora solo mezzogiorno e i loro corpi sentivano come se avessero raggiunto il loro limite.

Steam (ST): The thought of going to the kitchen in the mansion and bringing back some food certainly was attractive.
Umineko Project (UP): The thought of going to the kitchen in the mansion and bringing back some food certainly was attractive.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The thought of going to the kitchen in the mansion and bringing back some food certainly was attractive.
PC Japanese (JP): 屋敷の厨房へ行き、何か食料を持ってこようという話は、確かに魅力的だった。
Russian (RU): Мысль сходить в особняк и принести еды конечно же была крайне привлекательна.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O pensamento de ir à cozinha da mansão e trazer alguma comida certamente era atraente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 去一趟大屋廚房，帶點食物回來的提議，確實極具誘惑力。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 去一趟大屋厨房，带点食物回来的提议，确实极具诱惑力。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il pensiero di andare alla cucina della villa e tornare con del cibo era di sicuro allettante.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "I am opposed to this. It may be a little rough, but we definitely shouldn't leave this place."
Umineko Project (UP): "I am opposed to this. It may be a little tough, but we definitely shouldn't leave this place."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「私は反対です。多少は辛いでしょうが、断じてここを出るべきではありません。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私は反対です。多少は辛いでしょうが、断じてここを出るべきではありません」
Russian (RU): "Я против этого. Может, это и слегка непросто, но мы ни за что не должны покидать это место."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Me oponho a isso. Pode ser um pouco difícil, mas definitivamente não devíamos deixar este lugar."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我反對。雖然多少會有點難熬，但斷然不該從這裡出去。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我反对。虽然多少会有点难熬，但断然不该从这里出去。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sono contraria. Può essere dura, ma di certo non dovremmo lasciare questo posto."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Steam (ST): "...Don't worry about us, but it would pain my heart to keep the children hungry... I must be responsible as a parent."
Umineko Project (UP): "......It is alright for us. But it would pain my heart to keep the children hungry... I must bear my responsibility as a parent."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......We are fine. But it would pain my heart to keep the children hungry... I must bear my responsibility as a parent."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……私たちはいい。だが子どもたちにひもじい思いをさせるのは心が痛む…。親として責任を負わねばなるまい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……私たちはいい。だが子どもたちにひもじい思いをさせるのは心が痛む…。親として責任を負わねばなるまい」
Russian (RU): "......Мы‐то ещё ничего. Но мне не по душе морить детей голодом... Я должен нести ответственность как родитель."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Está tudo bem para nós. Mas machucaria meu coração deixar as crianças com fome... Devo carregar minha responsabilidade como pai."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……我們是不要緊。但讓孩子們遭罪，可就心痛了…。必須擔負起當父母的責任呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……我们是不要紧。但让孩子们遭罪，可就心痛了…。必须担负起当父母的责任呢。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Stiamo bene. Ma mi addolorerebbe lasciare i ragazzi affamati... devo portare avanti le mie responsabilità di genitore."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "D-Dear...! Now that Father is dead, you are the Ushiromiya Family Head. It is not permissible for you to take on such a danger...!"
Umineko Project (UP): "D‐dear...! Now that Father has passed away, you are the Ushiromiya family head. It is not permissible for you to take on such a danger...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "D, dear...! Now that Father is dead, you are the Ushiromiya family head. It is not permissible for you to take on such a danger...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「あ、あなた…！　お父様が亡くなられた今、右代宮家の当主はあなたです。そのような危険を冒すことは許されません…！」
Russian (RU): "Д‐дорогой! Теперь, когда умер отец, ты глава семьи Уширомия. Тебе непозволительно подвергать себя такой опасности!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Q‐Querido...! Agora que o pai faleceu, você é o chefe da família Ushiromiya. Não é permissível a você enfrentar tamanho perigo...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「老、老公…！爸已過世的現今，右代宮家的當主就是老公了啊。萬萬不可去冒此等大險…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「老、老公…！爸已过世的现今，右代宫家的当主就是老公了啊。万万不可去冒此等大险…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "C-Caro...! Ora che nostro Padre è morto, tu sei il capofamiglia Ushiromiya. Non è ammissibile che tu corra un simile pericolo...!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Steam (ST): "......You're right. It's like Natsuhi-san says. Krauss-san, you should remain here, as our leader."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Yes. It's like Natsuhi‐san says. Krauss‐san, you should remain here as the leader."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........You're right. It's like Natsuhi-san says. Krauss-san, you should remain here as the leader."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………そうね。夏妃さんの言う通りよ。蔵臼さんはリーダーとしてここに残るべきね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………そうね。夏妃さんの言う通りよ。蔵臼さんはリーダーとしてここに残るべきね」
Russian (RU): ".........Ты права. Нацухи дело говорит. Крауссу‐сану следует остаться здесь как лидеру."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Sim. É como a Natsuhi‐san diz. Kraus‐san, você devia permanecer aqui como o líder."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………是呢。夏妃姐姐說得對。藏臼哥應該作為主心骨留在這裡。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………是呢。夏妃姐姐说得对。藏臼哥应该作为主心骨留在这里。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Hai ragione. È come dice Natsuhi-san. Krauss-san, dovresti rimanere qua come leader."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Steam (ST): "...Then who will go to the mansion?"
Umineko Project (UP): "......Then, who will go to the mansion?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……なら、誰が屋敷へ行くんだね？」
Russian (RU): "......Тогда кто пойдёт в особняк?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Então, quem irá à mansão?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……那麼，由誰去大屋呢？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……那么，由谁去大屋呢？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Allora, chi andrà alla villa?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "I think it should be Kyrie and me, and Hideyoshi-san too. Hideyoshi-san and I have guns. They shouldn't be able to lay a hand on us that easily."
Umineko Project (UP): "I think Kyrie and I, and Hideyoshi nii‐san as well, should go. Hideyoshi nii‐san and I are holding guns. They shouldn't be able to lay a hand on us that easily."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I think Kyrie and I, and Hideyoshi-san as well, should go. Hideyoshi-san and I are holding guns. They shouldn't be able to lay a hand on us that easily."
PC Japanese (JP): 「俺と霧江、あと秀吉兄さんの３人で行こうと思う。俺と秀吉兄さんは銃を持ってる。そう簡単に向こうも手出しはできないはずだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「俺と霧江、あと秀吉兄さんの３人で行こうと思う。俺と秀吉兄さんは銃を持ってる。そう簡単に向こうも手出しはできないはずだ」
Russian (RU): "Думаю, Кирие, меня и Хидэёши‐сана будет вполне достаточно. Мы с Хидэёши вооружены ружьями. Так что нас так просто будет не взять."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Acho que devemos ir eu e a Kyrie, e também o Hideyoshi nii‐san. O Hideyoshi nii‐san e eu estamos carregando armas com a gente. Não devem ser capazes de pôr a mão em nós facilmente."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「就由我與霧江，再加上秀吉姐夫，三個人去吧。我與秀吉姐夫有槍。對方理應不敢輕易出手的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「就由我与雾江，再加上秀吉姐夫，三个人去吧。我与秀吉姐夫有枪。对方理应不敢轻易出手的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Penso che dovremmo andare Kyrie e io, e anche Hideyoshi-san. Hideyoshi-san e io abbiamo i fucili. Non saranno capaci di metterci le mani addosso tanto facilmente."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "Rosa-san also had a gun, but she was attacked. ...Won't it be dangerous?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Rosa‐san was also holding a gun, but she was attacked. ...Isn't it dangerous?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Rosa-san was also holding a gun, but she was attacked. ...Isn't it dangerous?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「楼座さんも銃を持っていましたが襲われました。…危険ではありませんか？」
Russian (RU): "Роза‐сан тоже была вооружена, когда на неё напали. ...Разве это не опасно?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A Rosa‐san também estava segurando uma arma, mas ela foi atacada. ...Isso não é perigoso?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「樓座妹妹也帶著槍，但還是遇襲了。…這不還是挺危險的嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「楼座妹妹也带着枪，但还是遇袭了。…这不还是挺危险的吗？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Anche Rosa-san aveva un fucile, ma è stata attaccata. ... Non è pericoloso?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "...When I went out to check on Rosa and Maria-chan, I had a gun, but I was alone. And yet, I wasn't attacked. ...Maybe they'll be cautious if their opponent is a man."
Umineko Project (UP): "...When I went out to check on Rosa and Maria‐chan, I was alone, although I had a gun with me. But I wasn't attacked. ......Maybe they'll be cautious if their opponent is a man."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...When I went out to check on Rosa and Maria-chan, I was the only one holding a gun. But I wasn't attacked. ......Maybe they'll be cautious if their opponent is a man."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…楼座たちの様子を確かめに出た時、銃を持っていたが俺はひとりだった。だが襲われなかった。……男が相手なら、向こうも慎重なのかもしれないぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…楼座たちの様子を確かめに出た時、銃を持っていたが俺はひとりだった。だが襲われなかった。……男が相手なら、向こうも慎重なのかもしれないぜ」
Russian (RU): "...Когда я пошёл поискать Розу и Марию‐чан, я был единственный с ружьём. Но на меня не напали. ......Наверное, они проявляют дополнительную осторожность, если противник — мужчина."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Quando saí para checar a Rosa e a Maria‐chan, eu estava sozinho, apesar de que tinha uma arma comigo. Mas não fui atacado. ......Talvez serão cuidadosos se seu oponente for um homem."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…剛才出去找樓座母女時，雖然帶了槍，但我是獨自一人。不過，並沒有遇襲。……或許換做男人，對方也就慎重起來了吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…刚才出去找楼座母女时，虽然带了枪，但我是独自一人。不过，并没有遇袭。……或许换做男人，对方也就慎重起来了吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Quando sono uscito per controllare Rosa e Maria-chan, ero l'unico che aveva una pistola. Ma non sono stato attaccato. ... Forse sono cauti se il loro avversario è un uomo."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Steam (ST): "We'll have two men. And even two guns. Those two will act as guards, and I'll transport our cargo using a cart. I believe the situation will be significantly different than it was for Rosa-san."
Umineko Project (UP): "Two men. And even two guns. Those two will act as guards, and I'll push the cart with the things. I believe the situation clearly differs from Rosa‐san's."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Two men. And even two guns. Those two will act as guards, and I'll push the cart with the luggage. I believe the situation will be clearly different from Rosa-san's."
PC Japanese (JP): 「男性が二人。そしてさらに銃も２丁。二人には護衛役に徹してもらって、荷物は台車で私が運ぶわ。楼座さんの時とは状況が明らかに異なるはずよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「男性が二人。そしてさらに銃も２丁。二人には護衛役に徹してもらって、荷物は台車で私が運ぶわ。楼座さんの時とは状況が明らかに異なるはずよ」
Russian (RU): "Двое мужчин. И два ружья. Они выступят в качестве телохранителей, а я буду толкать тележку с грузом. Полагаю, ситуация будет сильно отличаться от того, что было с Розой‐сан."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Dois homens. E com duas armas. Essas duas armas agirão como guardas enquanto eu transporto nossos suprimentos usando um carrinho de carga. Acredito que a situação é claramente diferente da situação da Rosa‐san."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「兩位男性。再加上兩把槍。兩位專心做好警衛，我推餐車運東西。與樓座妹妹那時的狀況應該是大不相同的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「两位男性。再加上两把枪。两位专心做好警卫，我推餐车运东西。与楼座妹妹那时的状况应该是大不相同的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Due uomini. E anche due fucili. Questi due faranno da guardia, e io spingerò il carrello coi viveri. Credo che la situazione sarà completamente diversa da quella di Rosa-san."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「こういう時くらいしか俺らには見せ場がないのさ。たまには譲って兄貴はのんびりしてろい。じゃな、夏妃さん。タオルの準備でもして待っててくれ。傘はささねぇから濡れ鼠で帰ってくるぜ」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Este é praticamente o único momento que temos para nos exibir. Sente‐se e pegue leve de vez em quando, aniki. Até mais tarde, Natsuhi‐san. Espere aqui e deixe algumas toalhas prontas ou algo assim. Não estamos levando guarda‐chuvas, então voltaremos como ratos encharcados."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「也就只有這種時候，有我們表現的機會啊。偶爾就讓讓我們，大哥悠閑地待著好了。那就這樣，夏妃嫂子。準備好毛巾等著吧。因為不撐傘，所以我們會淋成落湯雞回來的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「也就只有这种时候，有我们表现的机会啊。偶尔就让让我们，大哥悠闲地待着好了。那就这样，夏妃嫂子。准备好毛巾等着吧。因为不撑伞，所以我们会淋成落汤鸡回来的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Questa sarà più o meno l'unica volta che ci metteremo in mostra. Siediti e rilassati per una volta, Aniki. Va bene, Natsuhi-san. Aspetta qui e prepara qualche asciugamano o qualcosa di simile. Non useremo gli ombrelli, quindi saremo fradici fino al midollo quando torneremo."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "U-Understood. ...Take care."
Umineko Project (UP): "U‐understood. ...Take care."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "U, understood. ...Take care."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「わ、わかりました。…お気をつけて」
Russian (RU): "П‐понимаю. ...Будьте осторожны."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "E‐Entendido. ...Tomem cuidado."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「好、好的。…多加小心。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "H-Ho capito. ... siate prudenti."

Steam (ST): Rudolf, Kyrie, and Hideyoshi, each leaving their own brave words behind, left the lobby...
Umineko Project (UP): Rudolf, Kyrie, and Hideyoshi, each leaving their own brave words behind, left the lobby...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 留弗夫と霧江、そして秀吉の３人は、それぞれに勇ましい言葉を残し、ロビーを出て行くのだった…。
Russian (RU): Рудольф, Кирие и Хидэёши, каждый напоследок сказав смелые слова, покинули прихожую...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rudolf, Kyrie e Hideyoshi, cada um deixando suas próprias palavras corajosas para trás, deixaram o lobby...

Steam (ST): Compared to the time Rosa and Maria had gone outside, the winds were much stronger.
Umineko Project (UP): Compared to the time Rosa and Maria had gone outside, the winds had picked up once again.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Compared to the time Rosa and Maria had gone outside, the winds had picked up once again.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座たちが表に出た時に比べると、再び風は強くなっていた。
Russian (RU): По сравнению с тем, когда Роза с Марией вышли наружу, ветер вновь усилился.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Comparado à vez em que Rosa e Maria tinham saído, o vento havia fica mais intenso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 與樓座母女到外面時相比，風勢又大了不少。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 与楼座母女到外面时相比，风势又大了不少。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Paragonato a quando Rosa e Maria erano uscite, i venti soffiavano ancora più forti.

Steam (ST): Rudolf's group of three people jogged through the rose garden without umbrellas, holding their guns and a folded cart.
Umineko Project (UP): Rudolf's group of three people jogged through the rose garden without umbrellas, holding their guns and a folded cart.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rudolf's group of three people jogged through the rose garden without umbrellas, holding their guns and a folded cart.
PC Japanese (JP): 留弗夫たち３人は、傘をささず、銃や折り畳んだ台車を抱え、小走りに薔薇庭園を駆け抜けていく。
Russian (RU): Группа Рудольфа из трёх человек пробежали через розарий без зонтиков, держа в руках ружья и складную тележку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O grupo de três pessoas de Rudolf trotou sem guarda‐chuvas pelo jardim de rosas, segurando suas armas e um carrinho de carga dobrável.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 留弗夫一行三人，傘也不撐，抱著槍與折疊好的餐車，一路小跑，橫穿玫瑰庭園。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 留弗夫一行三人，伞也不撑，抱着枪与折叠好的餐车，一路小跑，横穿玫瑰庭园。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il gruppo di Rudolf di tre persone avanzava correndo attraverso il roseto senza ombrelli, tenendo le loro pistole e il carrello.

Steam (ST): If everything had been still and quiet, without the wind and the rain, they would probably have kept their ears open and moved with caution.
Umineko Project (UP): If everything had been still and quiet, without the wind and the rain, they would probably have kept their ears open and moved with caution.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If everything had been still and quiet, without the wind and the rain, they would probably have kept their ears open and moved with caution.
PC Japanese (JP): もしも雨も風の音もしない静寂だったなら、３人は耳を澄まし慎重に行動したかもしれない。
Russian (RU): Если бы погода была спокойной и тихой, без ветра и дождя, они наверняка бы навострили зрение и слух и перемещались бы с осторожностью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se tudo estivesse parado e quieto, sem o vento e a chuva, eles provavelmente teriam mantido seus ouvidos abertos e se moveriam com cuidado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如果此處是沒有風雨之聲的一片靜寂的話，三人或許會豎起耳朵，慎重地前進吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如果此处是没有风雨之声的一片静寂的话，三人或许会竖起耳朵，慎重地前进吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Se tutto fosse stato calmo e tranquillo senza vento e pioggia, probabilmente avrebbero tenuto gli occhi aperti e si sarebbero spostati con cautela.

Steam (ST): But in this rain, even if some suspicious person was hiding nearby, it would be difficult to notice them.
Umineko Project (UP): But in this rain, even if some suspicious person was hiding nearby, it would be difficult to notice them.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But in this rain, even if some suspicious person was hiding nearby, it would be difficult to notice them.
PC Japanese (JP): しかしこの雨では、近くに不審者が潜んでいたとしても、その気配を気取ることは困難だ。
Russian (RU): Но при таком дожде, даже если бы кто‐либо подозрительный и прятался поблизости, их было бы трудно заметить.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas, nesta chuva, mesmo se alguma pessoa suspeita estivesse se escondendo por perto, seria difícil percebê‐la.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可是，在這大雨之中，就算近處躲藏著可疑之人，也難以察覺到他的動靜。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是，在这大雨之中，就算近处躲藏着可疑之人，也难以察觉到他的动静。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma in questa pioggia, anche se qualche persona sospetta si stesse nascondendo lì vicino, sarebbe stato difficile accorgersene.

Steam (ST): Because of that, it had been Rudolf's plan to instead dash through the dangerous area.
Umineko Project (UP): Because of that, it had been Rudolf's plan to instead dash through the dangerous area.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because of that, it had been Rudolf's plan to instead dash through the dangerous area.
PC Japanese (JP): それならばむしろ、危険地帯を駆け抜けた方が良いだろうという留弗夫の提案だった。
Russian (RU): Поэтому Рудольф предложил вместо ходьбы пробежать через опасную зону.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por causa disso, tinha sido o plano de Rudolf correr pela área perigosa ao invés de apenas caminhar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此，留弗夫提議了，既然如此，那還不如迅速穿越危險地帶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此，留弗夫提议了，既然如此，那还不如迅速穿越危险地带。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perciò, il piano di Rudolf consisteva nel correre attraverso l'area pericolosa.

Steam (ST): ...If there was a chance that their opponent was equipped with a gun, then walking slowly with their guard up would only make them targets.
Umineko Project (UP): ......If there was a chance that their opponent was equipped with a gun, then walking slowly with their guard up would only make them a target.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……相手が銃で武装している可能性があるならば、固まってゆっくり歩くのは的にしてくれと言っているようなものだ。
Russian (RU): ......Если их противник мог оказаться вооружён огнестрельным оружием, то медленная ходьба через сад делала их идеальными мишенями.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Se houvesse uma chance de que o oponente deles estivesse equipado com uma arma, então caminhar lentamente com sua guarda baixa apenas faria deles um alvo fácil.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……只要存在對方武裝著槍的可能性，聚在一起慢慢走就等同於在說“把我們當成靶子吧”。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……只要存在对方武装着枪的可能性，聚在一起慢慢走就等同于在说“把我们当成靶子吧”。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Nel caso il loro nemico fosse stato armato di fucile, allora camminare lentamente con la guardia alzata li avrebbe solamente resi un bersaglio facile.

Steam (ST): Taking swift action was probably the correct choice.
Umineko Project (UP): It was probably correct to decide on swift action.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was probably correct to decide on swift action.
PC Japanese (JP): 迅速な行動はおそらく正しい判断だろう。
Russian (RU): Так что быстрое перемещение наверняка было правильным выбором.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Provavelmente decidir por uma ação veloz era a escolha correta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 迅速行動多半是個正確的判斷。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 迅速行动多半是个正确的判断。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era probabilmente corretto optare per un'azione rapida.

Umineko Project (UP): ".........The rose garden. It feels like we're just askin' to be attacked...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........O jardim de rosas. Parece até que estamos pedindo para sermos atacados...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………玫瑰庭園吶。搞不好對方會覺得，咱們是鴨子背蔥，自個兒送上了門吶…！」

Steam (ST): "Please, let nobody come out of there..."
Umineko Project (UP): "Please, let nobody come out of there..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Steam (ST): Even as Rudolf and Hideyoshi continued to run, they looked around restlessly, vigilant of their surroundings.
Umineko Project (UP): Even as Rudolf and Hideyoshi continued to run, they looked around restlessly, vigilant of their surroundings.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Russian (RU): Хотя Рудольф с Хидэёши продолжали бежать, они беспокойно оглядывались по сторонам, следя за окружающей обстановкой.

Steam (ST): Rosa and Maria's deaths had not been caused by a projectile weapon. ...However, it was easy to suspect that the servants had been killed in such a manner.
Umineko Project (UP): Rosa and Maria's deaths had not been caused by a projectile.{n}......However, it was easy to suspect that the servants had been killed in such a manner.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa and Maria's deaths had not been caused by a projectile.......However, it was easy to suspect that the servants had been killed in such a manner.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座と真里亞の死因は飛び道具ではない。……しかし、使用人たちの死因はそれを疑えるものだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 楼座と真里亞の死因は飛び道具ではない。{n}……しかし、使用人たちの死因はそれを疑えるものだった。
Russian (RU): Смерти Розы и Марии не были вызваны орудием, поражающим на расстоянии.{n}......Однако было легко подозревать, что слуги были убиты в такой же манере.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As mortes de Rosa e Maria não tinham sido causadas por um projétil.{n}......Porém, era fácil suspeitar que os serviçais haviam sido mortos de tal maneira.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座與真里亞的死並非遠程武器所致。{n}……不過，傭人們的死卻令人如此懷疑。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座与真里亚的死并非远程武器所致。{n}……不过，佣人们的死却令人如此怀疑。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La morte di Rosa e Maria non era stata causata da un proiettile. ... Tuttavia, era facile sospettare che i domestici fossero stati uccisi in quella maniera.

Steam (ST): Will they come flying out of the dark? Or will they take careful aim and snipe from the shadows?
Umineko Project (UP): Will they come flying out of the dark?{n}Or will they take careful aim and snipe from the shadows?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Will they come flying out of the dark? Or will they take careful aim and snipe from the shadows?
PC Japanese (JP): 暗がりから飛び掛って来るか。それとも狙いを済まして闇から狙撃してくるか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 暗がりから飛び掛って来るか。{n}それとも狙いを済まして闇から狙撃してくるか。
Russian (RU): Вылетят ли они из тьмы?{n}Или будут как снайперы тщательно прицеливаться и стрелять из тьмы?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O culpado virá voando, saindo da escuridão?{n}Ou tomará sua mira cuidadosamente, atirando das sombras?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 會從暗處撲上來嗎？{n}還是會在完成瞄準後，從黑暗之中進行狙擊呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 会从暗处扑上来吗？{n}还是会在完成瞄准后，从黑暗之中进行狙击呢？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sbucherà fuori dall'oscurità? O prenderà attentamente la mira e sparerà dall'ombra?

Steam (ST): ...Either way, they couldn't relax their tension for even an instant.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Either way, they couldn't relax their tension for even an instant.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……いずれにせよ、緊張感を解くことは一瞬たりともできない。
Russian (RU): ......В любом случае, они не могли расслабиться, чтобы прогнать напряжение, даже на мгновение.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......De qualquer forma, eles não podiam relaxar sua tensão nem por um instante.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不管怎樣，緊張感一瞬都不能鬆懈。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不管怎样，紧张感一瞬都不能松懈。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... In ogni caso, non poterono rilassarsi nemmeno per un istante.

Steam (ST): But even so, when they reached the overhang in front of the entrance to the mansion and escaped the reach of the raindrops, they felt themselves breathing a sigh of relief.
Umineko Project (UP): But even so, when they reached the overhang in front of the entrance to the mansion and escaped the reach of the raindrops, they felt themselves breathing a sigh of relief.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But even so, when they reached the overhang in front of the entrance to the mansion and escaped the reach of the raindrops, they felt themselves breathing a sigh of relief.
PC Japanese (JP): しかしそうではあっても、屋敷の玄関の軒下に辿り着き、雨粒から逃れられると、ほーっと安堵の息が漏れるのを感じるのだった。
Russian (RU): И тем не менее, когда они достигли навеса перед входом в особняк и укрылись от дождевых капель, они почувствовали, как вздыхают с облегчением.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ainda assim, quando alcançaram o alpendre na frente da entrada da mansão e escaparam do alcance das gotas da chuva, eles se encontraram suspirando aliviados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過即便如此，在到達大屋大門前的屋檐下，逃出雨滴的侵襲時，他們還是不禁“呼——”地吐出了一口安心之氣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过即便如此，在到达大屋大门前的屋檐下，逃出雨滴的侵袭时，他们还是不禁“呼——”地吐出了一口安心之气。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma anche così, quando raggiunsero la sporgenza di fronte all'entrata della villa e sfuggirono alle gocce di pioggia, sentirono di poter tirare un sospiro di sollievo.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Steam (ST): "No problems for the first step. ...Unlike how it was for Rosa-san. Maybe they can't get their hands on us easily."
Umineko Project (UP): "No problems for the first part. ......It's not like how it was for Rosa‐san. Maybe they can't get their hands on us easily."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "No problems for the first part. ......Unlike how it was for Rosa-san. Maybe they can't get their hands on us easily."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sem problemas na primeira parte. ......Não é como foi com a Rosa‐san. Talvez não consigam pôr suas mãos em nós tão facilmente."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "I'd like to believe that. Kyrie, unlock the door while we keep a lookout."
Umineko Project (UP): "I'd like to believe that. Kyrie, unlock the door while we keep a lookout."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そう信じたいね。霧江、俺たちが見張ってる間に鍵を開けてくれ」

Umineko Project (UP): "Sure. Returning home to the mansion with a pair of bodyguards makes me feel just like an executive."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Sure. Returning home to the mansion with a pair of SP's makes me feel just like an executive."
PC Japanese (JP): 「えぇ。ＳＰが二人もついてお屋敷に帰宅だなんて、実にエグゼクティブな気分よ。」

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お出迎えか。…あるかもな。用心しようぜ」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Uma festa de boas‐vindas, é? ...Cuidado com o que você deseja. Fique alerta."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「出迎吗？…或许是会有呢。小心点。」

Steam (ST): As the two cautiously surveyed their surroundings, Kyrie unlocked the entrance with the master key she had been given.
Umineko Project (UP): As the two cautiously surveyed their surroundings, Kyrie unlocked the front door with the master key she had been given.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As the two cautiously surveyed their surroundings, Kyrie unlocked the entrance with the master key she had been given.
PC Japanese (JP): 二人が用心深く辺りを警戒する中、霧江は預かったマスターキーで玄関を開錠する。
Russian (RU): Пока они оба исследовали окружающую обстановку, Кирие открыла дверь данным ей универсальным ключом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Enquanto os dois cuidadosamente vigiavam seus arredores, Kyrie destrancou a porta da frente com a chave mestra que ela tinha recebido.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 两人小心翼翼地警戒四周，雾江则用之前拿到的总钥匙打开了门锁。

Umineko Project (UP): "It's open."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「开了。」

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「秀吉兄さん。先頭を頼めるか。俺は背後を警戒するぜ」

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「秀吉姐夫。能拜托你负责先头吗？我来警戒背后。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Hideyoshi-san. Puoi andare davanti? io vi terrò d'occhio da dietro."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Steam (ST): "Understood. Kyrie-san, try not to move from my shadow. ...Okay, let's break in!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Roger. Kyrie‐san, try not to move from my shadow. ......Alright, let's break in!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Understood. Kyrie-san, try not to move from my shadow. ......Alright, let's break in!"

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Afirmativo. Kyrie‐san, tente não sair da minha sombra. ......Tudo limpo, vamos arrombar!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「了解。雾江弟妹，不要从俺的背后出来呐。……呵呀，开始突入！」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf

Umineko Project (UP): "Rear guard, understood. Covering...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Retaguarda, entendido. Dando cobertura...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「後方了解，進行掩護…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「后方了解，进行掩护…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Retroguardia, ricevuto. Copertura...!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie

Umineko Project (UP): "......Men. You're enjoying this situation a little bit, aren't you?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Men. You're just playing around in a situation like this, aren't you?"

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……男の人って嫌ぁね。この状況をちょっぴり楽しんでるでしょ」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Ah, os homens... Estão se divertindo um pouco com esta situação, não é?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……男人也真是的。你們是略微有點享受這種狀況吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……男人也真是的。你们是略微有点享受这种状况吧？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Ah, gli uomini. Stai giocando anche in una situazione come questa, vero?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf

Umineko Project (UP): "Give it up, that's how men are. ......But man, there's still that rank stench."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Give it up, that's how men are. ......But man, there's still that awful stench."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「諦めろよ、それが男ってモンだぜ。……しかし、相変わらず酷ぇ臭いだな」
Russian (RU): "Смирись, такие уж мы мужчины. ......Вот чёрт побери, здесь всё ещё сохранилась эта ужасная вонь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Desista, é como homens são. ......Mas, poxa, ainda tem aquele fedor medonho."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「死心吧，這就是男人啊。……話說回來，這兒依舊好大的味啊。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「死心吧，这就是男人啊。……话说回来，这儿依旧好大的味啊。」

Umineko Project (UP): ...The air in the mansion felt stagnant with a heavy silence.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...It felt like the air in the mansion was stagnant with a gloomy silence.
PC Japanese (JP): …屋敷内の空気は、重苦しい静寂で澱んでいるように感じられた。
Russian (RU): ...В воздухе особняка висела мрачная тишина.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...O ar na mansão parecia estagnado com um silêncio pesado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …大屋內的空氣，被壓抑的靜寂凝結得有如一潭死水。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …大屋内的空气，被压抑的静寂凝结得有如一潭死水。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Era come se l'aria nella villa fosse stagnante con un cupo silenzio.

Steam (ST): And on top of that, it was still thick with the stench from Kinzo's burnt corpse in the boiler room, and they were struck with an uncontrollable desire to leave the mansion.
Umineko Project (UP): And worse, it was still thick with the stench from Kinzo's burnt corpse in the boiler room, and they were struck with a strong desire to leave the mansion—although they were never planning to stay.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And on top of that, it was still thick with the stench from Kinzo's burnt corpse in the boiler room, and they were struck with an uncontrollable desire to leave the mansion.
PC Japanese (JP): そしてそれ以上に、ボイラー室からの金蔵の焼死体の異臭は未だに濃厚で、頼まれなくても屋敷を出たい気持ちに駆られた。
Russian (RU): И к ней примешивался густой смрад от обгорелого трупа Кинзо в котельной, из‐за чего у них сразу возникло неуправляемое желание как можно скорее покинуть особняк.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E pior, ele ainda estava espesso, com o fedor do cadáver queimado de Kinzo na sala da caldeira, e eles foram atingidos com um forte desejo de deixar a mansão — apesar que eles nunca estiveram planejando ficar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 再加上從鍋爐室飄出的金藏屍體的異臭依然很是濃烈，所以，不用人催，他們也急著想快點從大屋出去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 再加上从锅炉室飘出的金藏尸体的异臭依然很是浓烈，所以，不用人催，他们也急着想快点从大屋出去。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Inoltre, era ancora pregna della puzza del cadavere bruciato di Kinzo nel locale caldaia, e loro furono presi da un incontrollabile desiderio di lasciare la villa.

Umineko Project (UP): "No problems in the front. Just a short dash to the kitchen."

Umineko Project (UP): The three of them dashed towards the kitchen...

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E depois que eles desapareceram do hall de entrada...... a nova bruxa apareceu ali.

Umineko Project (UP): "They were lured out just as planned. ......They got caught right in my trap."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "They were lured out just as planned. ......Just as planned, they got caught in my trap."

Umineko Project (UP): The witch grinned.

Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Steam (ST): ...Thinking about it now, no matter how unbearable their hunger had grown, it hadn't even been a few hours since Rosa and Maria had been attacked and had lost their lives.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Thinking about it now, no matter how unbearable their hunger had grown, barely a few hours had passed since Rosa and Maria had been attacked and had lost their lives.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……今にして考えれば、いくら耐え難い空腹感があったとはいえ、楼座たちが襲われて命を落としてから数時間も経っていない。
Russian (RU): ......Если подумать, каким бы невыносимым ни был их голод, с того момента, как на Розу с Марией напали и убили их, едва ли прошло несколько часов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Pensando nisso agora, não importa quão insuportável sua fome tivesse crescido, poucas horas tinham se passado desde que a Rosa e a Maria tinham sido atacadas e perdido suas vidas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……現在一想，再怎麼飢餓難耐，距樓座母女遇襲喪命也根本就沒過幾個小時啊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……现在一想，再怎么饥饿难耐，距楼座母女遇袭丧命也根本就没过几个小时啊。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Pensandoci ora, non importa quando fosse diventata insopportabile la loro fame, erano passate solo poche ore da quando Rosa e Maria erano state attaccate e avevano perso le loro vite.

Steam (ST): In that case, why had they needed to recklessly leave the guesthouse...?
Umineko Project (UP): In that case, why had they needed to recklessly leave the guesthouse...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In that case, why had they needed to recklessly leave the guesthouse...?
PC Japanese (JP): にもかかわらず、なぜ彼らは無用心にもゲストハウスを出なければならなかったのだろう…。
Russian (RU): Тогда зачем им нужно было столь опрометчиво уйти из домика для гостей?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nesse caso, por que eles precisavam, imprudentemente, deixar a casa de hóspedes...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 既然如此，他們又是為什麼一定要魯莽地從賓館出來呢…？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 既然如此，他们又是为什么一定要鲁莽地从宾馆出来呢…？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In questo caso, che bisogno c'era di lasciare così avventatamente la casa degli ospiti...?

Steam (ST): Until that question could be dealt with, the only answer was that they had been called out by the witch's magic...
Umineko Project (UP): Until that question could be dealt with, the only answer was that they had been called out by the witch's magic...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): その疑問が埋められない内は、魔女の魔法の力で呼び出されたということにする他ない…。
Russian (RU): Пока этот вопрос не будет рассмотрен и обдуман, единственным ответом будет, что их позвала магия ведьмы...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Até que se pudesse lidar com aquela questão, a única resposta era que eles tinham sido chamados pela magia da bruxa...

Chinese Simplified (CN): 只要还无法解答这个疑问，就只能将此视为，是由魔女的魔法之力呼唤而出…。

Steam (ST): "What reckless people. ...They'll never leave this mansion alive. Seal yourself, lock. Seal yourself, mansion!"
Umineko Project (UP): "What reckless people. ......They will never leave this mansion alive. Lock yourself, locks! Close yourself, mansion!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "What reckless people. ......They will never leave this mansion alive. Close yourself, lock. Mansion!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「無用心なヤツら。……もう生きてこの屋敷から出しはしないわ。閉じよ、鍵よ。屋敷よ！」
Russian (RU): "Какие неосторожные люди. ......Они ни за что не покинут этот особняк живыми. Закройся, запрись, Особняк!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Que pessoas imprudentes. ......Eles nunca sairão vivos desta mansão.{n}Trancas, tranquem‐se! Mansão, feche‐se!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「麻痹大意的家伙们。……你们已经无法活着走出这幢大屋了。上锁，封屋！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Che persone incoscienti. ... Non lasceranno mai vivi questa villa. Chiuditi, serrati. Villa!"

Steam (ST): The instant she proclaimed that...
Umineko Project (UP): The instant she proclaimed that...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Steam (ST): Her absurd argument was, for an Endless Witch, an extremely valid one. The etiquette that controlled the manner of killing the sacrifices of the fourth twilight and onward was represented by lines like "gouge the head".
Umineko Project (UP): Her wild logic was, for an Endless Witch, an extremely valid argument.{n}The sacrifices for the fourth twilight and onward had prescribed protocols for the method of killing, represented by things like "gouge the head".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Her ranting was, for an Endless Witch, an extremely valid argument. The etiquette deciding the style of killing for the sacrifices of the fourth twilight and onward were represented by things like 'gouge the head'.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼女の暴論は、無限の魔女としては極めて正論。第四の晩以降の生贄は、“頭を抉れ”に代表されるように殺し方の作法が決まっている。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 彼女の暴論は、無限の魔女としては極めて正論。{n}第四の晩以降の生贄は、“頭を抉れ”に代表されるように殺し方の作法が決まっている。
Russian (RU): Её болтовня была крайне веской как аргумент Золотой Ведьмы.{n}Церемониал, устанавливающий стиль убийства жертв на четвертые сумерки и далее, основывался на нанесении колотых ран в определённые части тела.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A lógica selvagem dela era, para uma Bruxa do Infinito, um argumento extremamente válido.{n}Os sacrifícios do quarto crepúsculo e subsequentes tinham protocolos a serem seguidos quanto ao método de assassinato, representado por coisas como "goive a cabeça".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她的謬論，對無限魔女而言，乃是極其正確的見解。{n}第四晚以後的活祭，以“剜頭”為代表，是有著固定的殺法的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她的谬论，对无限魔女而言，乃是极其正确的见解。{n}第四晚以后的活祭，以“剜头”为代表，是有着固定的杀法的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La sua invettiva era, per una Strega dell'Infinito, un ragionamento estremamente valido. La cerimonia che decideva lo stile di uccisione per i sacrifici dal quarto crepuscolo in poi era rappresentato da cose come ‘perfora la testa’.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然本該由兩位男性專心負責護衛，但運這麼重的箱子，就算是有餐車，霧江也吃不消。

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I due uomini in teoria avrebbero dovuto dedicarsi alla guardia, ma il peso del carico era parecchio per Kyrie anche sul carrello.

Steam (ST): Hideyoshi, who wanted to show off his power, switched to be the cart-pusher, and Rudolf and his wife took up the task of guard duty.
Umineko Project (UP): Hideyoshi, who professed himself strong, switched to being the cart‐pusher, and Rudolf and his wife took up the task of guard duty.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Hideyoshi, who wanted to show off his power, switched to be the cart-pusher, and Rudolf and his wife took up the task of guard duty.
PC Japanese (JP): 力自慢を自称する秀吉が台車役を代わり、護衛役は留弗夫夫妻が勤めた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 力自慢を自称する秀吉が台車役を代わり、護衛役は留弗夫夫妻が務めた。
Russian (RU): Хидэёши, желавший покрасоваться своей силой, сменил Кирие, а Рудольф с женой занялись охраной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Hideyoshi, que tinha se declarado forte, trocou com ela para ser o empurrador do carrinho, e Rudolf e sua esposa tomaram a tarefa de fazer a guarda.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 換由自稱力氣大的秀吉來代她推車，而留弗夫夫妻擔任警衛。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 换由自称力气大的秀吉来代她推车，而留弗夫夫妻担任警卫。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Hideyoshi, che voleva mettere in mostra la sua potenza, si prese il ruolo di spingere il carrello, e Rudolf e sua moglie si presero il compito di fare la guardia.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Steam (ST): "With all this, even George and the kids will be full. The trip back'll be a picnic, so let's go...!"
Umineko Project (UP): "With all this, even George and the kids will be full. We're not safe until we're home, let's go...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "With all this, even George and the kids will be full. It'll be a picnic until we get back, let's go...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「これだけあれば、譲治たちも満腹やろ。帰るまでが遠足や、行くで…！」
Russian (RU): "При таком количестве даже Джордж с детьми смогут наесться. Будет пикник, пока мы не вернёмся, идём!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Com tudo isto, até o George e as crianças ficarão cheios. Não estamos seguros até estarmos de volta, vamos...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「有了這些，讓治他們也能填飽肚子了吶。在到家前都不能算搞定了吶，出發…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「有了这些，让治他们也能填饱肚子了呐。在到家前都不能算搞定了呐，出发…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Con tutto questo, anche George e i ragazzi saranno sazi. Sarà un picnic fino a quando non ritorneremo, andiamo...!"

Steam (ST): When Hideyoshi vigorously announced their departure, Kyrie frowned and seemed to be gazing into the distance.
Umineko Project (UP): When Hideyoshi vigorously proclaimed their departure, Kyrie frowned, looking as though she was gazing into the distance.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 秀吉が威勢よく出発を宣言した時、霧江が表情をしかめ、遠くを見るような目をした。
Russian (RU): Когда Хидэёши бодро заявил об их уходе, Кирие нахмурилась, глядя так, словно всматриваясь куда‐то вдаль.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando Hideyoshi proclamou vigorosamente a partida deles, Kyrie franziu a testa, parecendo estar encarando algo à distância.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在秀吉氣勢十足地宣言出發時，霧江眉頭一皺，雙眼猶如望向了遠方。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在秀吉气势十足地宣言出发时，雾江眉头一皱，双眼犹如望向了远方。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando Hideyoshi annunciò vigorosamente la loro partenza, Kyrie si accigliò, come se stesse guardando a distanza.

Steam (ST): ...There was a wall in that direction. ...No, if her gaze could go through that, there was the main hall beyond it...
Umineko Project (UP): ......There was a wall in that direction. ...No, if her gaze could go through that, the hall was beyond it...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......There was a wall in that direction....No, if her gaze could go through that, the hall was beyond it...
PC Japanese (JP): ……その方向には壁がある。…いや、視線が貫けるならば、その向こうにはホールがある…。
Russian (RU): ......В направлении её взгляда находилась стена. ...Нет, даже если её взгляд и преодолевал стену, за ней находилась ещё стена...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Havia uma parede naquela direção. ...Não, se o seu olhar pudesse atravessá‐la, havia o hall além...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……她的視線前方是一堵牆。…不，視線若是穿透了它的話，那就是落到了牆壁另一側的門廳…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……她的视线前方是一堵墙。…不，视线若是穿透了它的话，那就是落到了墙壁另一侧的门厅…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... C'era una parete in quella direzione. ... No, se lo sguardo l'avesse attraversata, oltre di essa c'era l'atrio...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "......What is it, Kyrie?"
Umineko Project (UP): ".........What is it, Kyrie?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「………どうした、霧江。」
Russian (RU): ".........В чём дело, Кирие?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........O que foi, Kyrie?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………怎麼了，霧江？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………怎么了，雾江？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Che cosa c'è, Kyrie?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Steam (ST): "...It's vague, ......but I've got a bad feeling gnawing at me."
Umineko Project (UP): "...I sense something. .........I have a bad feeling about this."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...It's vague, .........but I have a bad feeling about this."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…チリチリするの。………嫌な予感がするわ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…チリチリするの。………嫌な予感がするわ」
Russian (RU): "...Нечто смутное... Что‐то у меня дурное предчувствие."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Sinto alguma coisa. .........Tenho um pressentimento ruim sobre isto."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…直打冷顫。………我有不好的預感。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…直打冷颤。………我有不好的预感。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Non è ben definito... ma ho un cattivo presentimento."

Steam (ST): Kyrie stopped walking and narrowed her eyes even further.
Umineko Project (UP): Kyrie stopped, narrowing her eyes even further.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 霧江は足を止め、なおも目を細めるような仕草をする。
Russian (RU): Кирие остановилась, ещё сильнее сощурив глаза.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kyrie parou, cerrando ainda mais seus olhos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 霧江停下腳步，依然眯著眼睛。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 雾江停下脚步，依然眯着眼睛。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Kyrie si fermò, stringendo ancora di più gli occhi.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "......Women's intuition?"
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Women's intuition?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「………女の勘か？」
Russian (RU): ".........Женская интуиция?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Intuição feminina?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………女人的直覺嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………女人的直觉吗？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Intuito femminile?"

Steam (ST): At times like this, Kyrie's intuition often rang true, even when she didn't have a logical reason. ...Rudolf believed in that intuition.
Umineko Project (UP): In times like this, Kyrie's intuition surpassed reason.{n}...Rudolf trusted that intuition.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In times like this, Kyrie's intuition surpassed reason....Rudolf believed that intuition.
PC Japanese (JP): こういう時の霧江の勘は、理屈抜きに当たる。…留弗夫はその勘を信じた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): こういう時の霧江の勘は、理屈抜きに当たる。{n}…留弗夫はその勘を信じた。
Russian (RU): В подобные моменты интуиция Кирие превосходила разум.{n}...Рудольф верил в эту интуицию.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em horas como esta, a intuição de Kyrie ultrapassava a razão.{n}...Rudolf confiava naquela intuição.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在這種情況下，霧江的直覺是毋須理由的非常准的。{n}…留弗夫相信了她的這份直覺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在这种情况下，雾江的直觉是毋须理由的非常准的。{n}…留弗夫相信了她的这份直觉。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In momenti come questi, l'intuito di Kyrie superava la ragione. ... E Rudolf ci credeva.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Steam (ST): "Yes. Someone's probably waiting to ambush us. ...I didn't sense them before, ...but just now, I felt it. ...Just now someone... {i:set up an ambush for us}."
Umineko Project (UP): "Yes. Someone's probably waiting to ambush us. ......I didn't sense them until a short while ago. ...But just now, I felt it. ......Just now, someone...{i:set up an ambush for us}."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Yes. Someone's probably waiting to ambush us. ......I didn't sense them until a short while ago. ...But just now, I felt it. ......Just now someone,set up an ambush for us."
PC Japanese (JP): 「えぇ。多分、私たちは待ち伏せされてる。……さっきまではその気配はなかったの。…でも、たった今、感じたわ。……たった今、私たちは、{i:待ち伏せられた}。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「えぇ。多分、私たちは待ち伏せされてる。……さっきまではその気配はなかったの。…でも、たった今、感じたわ。……たった今、私たちは、{i:待ち伏せられた}」
Russian (RU): "Да. Похоже, кто‐то намеревается устроить нам засаду. ......Доселе я их не чувствовала. ...А вот сейчас ощутила. ......Словно кто‐то {i:устроил нам засаду}."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim. Alguém provavelmente está esperando para nos emboscar. ......Não o senti até um curto momento atrás. ...Mas, ainda há pouco, eu senti. ......Ainda há pouco, alguém...{i:armou uma emboscada para nós}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「沒錯。多半有人要伏擊我們。……直到剛才還沒這感覺。…但是，就在此刻，我感覺到了。……就在此刻，有人等著，{i:伏擊我們}。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「没错。多半有人要伏击我们。……直到刚才还没这感觉。…但是，就在此刻，我感觉到了。……就在此刻，有人等着，{i:伏击我们}。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sì. Probabilmente qualcuno ci sta aspettando per tenderci una imboscata. ... Non l'ho percepito fino a poco fa. ... Ma proprio ora, l'ho avvertito. ... Proprio ora qualcuno, ci sta preparando una imboscata."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "...Then there's no reason to go back the way we came. There's a back door over there, right? Let's leave that way."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Then, there's no reason we need to return the way we came. There's a back door over there, right? Let's leave that way."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Then, there's no reason we should return the way we came. There's a back door over there, right? Let's leave that way."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……なら、来た道を戻る義理はねぇな。そこに勝手口があるじゃねぇか。そっちから出よう。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……なら、来た道を戻る義理はねぇな。そこに勝手口があるじゃねぇか。そっちから出よう」
Russian (RU): "......Нам нет причины возвращаться тем путём, которым пришли. Здесь ведь есть чёрный ход, верно? Давайте уйдём через него."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Então, não há razão para precisarmos voltar pelo caminho por onde viemos. Tem uma porta dos fundos bem aqui, certo? Vamos sair por esse caminho."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……那麼，就沒理由原路返回了啊。這兒不是有後門嘛。從那裡出去吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……那么，就没理由原路返回了啊。这儿不是有后门嘛。从那里出去吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Allora, non c'è ragione di tornare da dove siamo venuti. C'è una porta sul retro lì, giusto? Andiamo da quella porta."

Steam (ST): Rudolf made to unlock the back door.
Umineko Project (UP): Rudolf made to unlock the back door.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 留弗夫は勝手口の扉の鍵を開けようとする。
Russian (RU): Рудольф открыл дверь чёрного хода.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rudolf fez menção de destrancar a porta dos fundos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 留弗夫上前，想打開後門的門鎖。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 留弗夫上前，想打开后门的门锁。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rudolf andò a sbloccare la porta sul retro.

Steam (ST): When goods were carried into the kitchen, they never passed through the part of the mansion that the family came and went from.
Umineko Project (UP): When things were carried into the kitchen, they never passed through the part of the mansion that the family came and went from.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When luggage was carried into the kitchen, it never passed through the part of the mansion that the family came and went from.
PC Japanese (JP): 厨房への荷物の運び込みは、家人たちが出入りする屋敷内を決して通りはしない。
Russian (RU): Когда багаж переносился на кухню, то его не перемещали по той части особняка, через которую приходили или уходили члены семьи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando as coisas eram carregadas para a cozinha, elas nunca passavam pela parte da mansão na qual a família ia e vinha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 搬往廚房的貨物，絕不會經由有家人出入的大屋。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 搬往厨房的货物，绝不会经由有家人出入的大屋。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando i carichi venivano portati in cucina, non passavano mai dalla parte della villa dove la famiglia entrava e usciva.

Steam (ST): So outside the back door, there was probably a ramp used to carry things in. Surely, they would be able to leave through there with the cart.
Umineko Project (UP): So outside the back door, there was probably a slope for transporting things. Surely, they would be able to leave through there with the cart.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So outside the back door, there was probably a slope to carry things in. Surely, they would be able to leave through there with the cart.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、勝手口の外には搬入用のスロープもあるだろう。きっと台車はここから出られる。
Russian (RU): Так что снаружи чёрного хода наверняка находился склон, предназначенный для того, чтобы заносить вещи внутрь. В таком случае покинуть особняк с тележкой представлялось вполне возможным.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, saindo pela da porta dos fundos, provavelmente haveria uma rampa para transportar coisas. Certamente, eles seriam capazes de sair por ali com o carrinho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，後門外應該有用於運貨的斜坡。餐車一定能從此處推出去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，后门外应该有用于运货的斜坡。餐车一定能从此处推出去。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi sulla porta del retro, probabilmente c'era una pendenza per facilitare il trasporto delle cose. Di certo, sarebbero stati capaci di andare via da lì con il carrello.

Steam (ST): Rudolf tried various things, first using force, then coaxing it, but the lock was as hard as stone and didn't even budge.

Russian (RU): Сначала Рудольф попытался добиться своего силой, затем уговорами, но замок оставался твёрдым как камень и упорно не желал открываться.

Umineko Project (UP): "............I can't believe it. A lowly {y:0:Human}{n:0:human} predicted our ambush?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "............I can't believe it. A lowly human predicted our ambush?"

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As balas de chumbo explodiram direto através da defesa mágica do par tão facilmente como se fosse uma parede de papel molhado, ......mas as duas que deveriam estar ali tinham desaparecido.

Steam (ST): ...But there was no need to fear as long as they weren't hit. They at least had enough speed to dodge those.

Speaker: Leviathan
Steam (ST): "Wait a sec! You won't even give us a chance to say our names?! This is why I hate Humans!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Wait a sec! You won't even let us say our names?! This is why I hate {y:0:Human}{n:0:human}s!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Wait a sec! You won't even let us say our names?! This is why I hate humans!"

Umineko Project (UP): Leviathan protested, popping her head out from behind a pillar in the shadow of the staircase, a full ten meters from where she had supposedly been.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Leviathan was a full 10 meters from where she had supposedly been, popping her head out from behind the pillars in the shadow of the staircase and protesting.
PC Japanese (JP): レヴィアタンは、本来いたはずの場所から１０ｍ以上も離れた、階段の影の柱からひょっこりと顔をのぞかせて抗議する。

Speaker: Belphegor
Steam (ST): "In accordance with {f:5:Beatrice}-sama's orders, we will hunt you down! Our orders tell us to make it take some time and to tease you. You are free to resist, but know that it will be useless...!"
Umineko Project (UP): "By order of {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama, we shall now slay you! We are ordered to take some time teasing you. You are free to resist, but know that it is useless...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Following Beatrice-sama's orders, we are to attack you! Our orders tell us to make it take some time and to tease you. You are free to resist, but know that it is useless...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ベアトリーチェさまのご命令により、貴様らを討つ！　時間を掛けて甚振れとのご命令だ。抵抗は自由、されど無駄と知れ…！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ベアトリーチェさまのご命令により、貴様らを討つ！　時間を掛けて屠れとのご命令だ。抵抗は自由、されど無駄と知れ…！」
Russian (RU): "Согласно приказу {f:5:Беатриче}‐сама, мы должны напасть на вас! Наш приказ гласит, чтобы мы не спешили и поиграли с вами. Вы можете сопротивляться, только учтите — это бесполезно!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Pela ordem da {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama, devemos eliminá‐los agora! Fomos ordenadas a gastar algum tempo provocando vocês. Estão livres para resistir, mas saibam que isso é inútil...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「奉貝阿朵莉切夫人之命，討伐爾等！夫人的命令，是花時間慢慢折磨。可以自由抵抗，但須知，此為徒勞…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「奉贝阿朵莉切夫人之命，讨伐尔等！夫人的命令，是花时间慢慢折磨。可以自由抵抗，但须知，此为徒劳…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Seguendo gli ordini di Beatrice-sama, noi vi attaccheremo! I nostri ordini ci dicono di prendere un po' di tempo e di tormentarvi. Siete liberi di resistere, ma sappiate che è inutile...!"

Steam (ST): That voice came from overhead. Belphegor could be seen on top of the hall chandelier. Elegantly looking down upon them, she proclaimed their execution with a cruel smile.
Umineko Project (UP): That voice came from overhead.{n}Belphegor could be seen on top of the hall chandelier.{n}Elegantly looking down upon them, she proclaimed their execution with a cruel smile.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That voice came from overhead. Belphegor could be seen on top of the hall chandelier. Elegantly looking down upon them, she proclaimed their execution with a cruel smile.
PC Japanese (JP): その声は頭上から。ベルフェゴールの姿はホールのシャンデリアの上にあった。優雅に見下ろしながら、残酷な笑みで処刑を宣告する。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その声は頭上から。{n}ベルフェゴールの姿はホールのシャンデリアの上にあった。{n}優雅に見下ろしながら、残酷な笑みで処刑を宣告する。

Umineko Project (UP): "Forget the cart!! We have two opponents, so if we split up, they can't chase all of us!"

Steam (ST): In case of a crisis, they had planned to run off in separate directions, returning to the guesthouse by breaking windows or leaving through a back door.
Umineko Project (UP): They had already made plans to run off in separate directions in the case of a crisis, returning to the guesthouse by breaking windows or leaving through a back door.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the case of a crisis, they had planned to run off in separate directions, returning to the guesthouse by breaking windows or leaving through a back door.
PC Japanese (JP): それぞれに逃げて、窓を破るなり勝手口を出るなりしてゲストハウスへ逃げ帰ることで、緊急時の打ち合わせは済んでいる。
Russian (RU): В случае возникновения критической ситуации ими было решено бежать в разных направлениях, возвращаясь в домик для гостей, разбив окно или через чёрный ход.

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In caso di emergenza, avevano pianificato di correre in direzioni separate, ritornando alla casa degli ospiti rompendo le finestre o andando via dalla porta sul retro.

Umineko Project (UP): Fighting was forbidden. ......As long as they could get away.

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Combattere era proibito. ... Fino a quando era possibile scappare.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "Hahaha, in a tight spot, escaping is victory...!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Hah‐hah‐ha, of the thirty‐six stratagems, fleeing is best...!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hah-hah-ha, in a tight spot, escaping is victory...!"
