Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "......Well, I do understand. The endless power is fun. ...The joy of freely toying with an extremely limited life cannot be explained to those who have not tasted it. ...I can understand that feeling of being possessed with a pleasure similar to drugs."
Umineko Project (UP): "............Well, I understand. Endless power is fun. ...The joy of freely toying with a life, the epitome of finite things, cannot be explained to those who have not tasted it. ......I can understand the feeling of being possessed with that pleasure."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "............Well, I understand. Endless power is fun. ...The joy of freely toying with an extremely limited life cannot be explained to those who have not tasted it. ......I can understand the feeling of being possessed with a pleasure similar to drugs."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………まぁ、わかる。無限の力は楽しい。…有限の極みである命を、自在に弄ぶ快楽は、味わったことのない者には説明できぬ。……その麻薬にも似た快楽に取り憑かれる気持ち、わかろうというものよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………まぁ、わかる。無限の力は楽しい。…有限の極みである命を、自在に弄ぶ快楽は、味わったことのない者には説明できぬ。……その快楽に取り憑かれる気持ち、わかろうというものよ」
Russian (RU): "............Ну, я могу понять. Бесконечное могущество может служить источником веселья. ...Радость от нескованной игры с крайне ограниченной жизнью нельзя объяснить тем, кто сам не испытал этого. ......Я могу понять чувство одержимости удовольствием, схожим с наркотическим."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Bem, eu entendo. Poder infinito é divertido. ...A alegria de brincar com uma vida livremente, a epítome de coisas finitas, não pode ser explicada àqueles que não experimentaram. ......Consigo entender a sensação de ser possuída com esse prazer."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………我還是明白的。無限之力很好玩。…自由玩弄有限至極的生命所得到的快樂，無法向從未品嘗過這點之人說明。……妾身也是能理解這沉醉於快樂的感受的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………我还是明白的。无限之力很好玩。…自由玩弄有限至极的生命所得到的快乐，无法向从未品尝过这点之人说明。……妾身也是能理解这沉醉于快乐的感受的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Beh, ho capito. Il potere Infinito è divertente. ... Il divertimento di giocare liberamente con una vita estremamente limitata non può essere spiegato a coloro che non l'hanno provato. ... Io posso capire la sensazione di essere posseduta da un piacere simile a quello delle droghe."

Umineko Project (UP): "......It must have been quite fun. Judging from your antics in the past."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……さぞや楽しかったでしょうね。かつてのあなたのはしゃぎぶりを見る限り。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……さぞや楽しかったでしょうね。かつてのあなたのはしゃぎぶりを見る限り」
Russian (RU): "......Должно быть, было крайне весело. Судя по твоим выходкам в прошлом."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Isso deve ter sido bem divertido. Julgando das suas atitudes grotescas no passado."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……想必她很是開心呢。從你曾經的高興勁上看，定是如此。」

Steam (ST): "Are you saying...it's just like when you tried to admonish me in the past, over and over, and I did not listen...?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Are you saying it is like how you used to admonish me in the past, Master, and I did not listen...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Are you saying it is like how you used to admonish me in the past, Teacher, and I did not listen...?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「あれが、かつて何度も諭そうとしたお師匠様と、それに耳を貸さぬ妾の姿だというのか…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あれが、かつて何度も諭そうとしたお師匠様と、それに耳を貸さぬ妾の姿だというのか…」
Russian (RU): "Хотите сказать, это напоминает, как вы вразумляли меня в прошлом, а я не слушала?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você está dizendo que é como você costumava me admoestar no passado, professora, e eu não ouvi...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「您是說，那就像以前一次又一次地勸誡妾身的師傅，與牛不入耳的妾身嗎…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「您是说，那就像以前一次又一次地劝诫妾身的师傅，与牛不入耳的妾身吗…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sta dicendo che era sua abitudine ammonirmi in passato, Maestra, e che io non ascoltavo...?"

Steam (ST): "......Why have you started trying to scold that child for her actions?"
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Why is it that you have started trying to scold that child for her actions?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Why is it that you have started trying to scold that child's actions?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………なぜ、あの子の行為を咎める気になったのですか？」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Por que você começou a tentar repreender aquela criança pelas ações dela?"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………为什么，想到了去责备那孩子的行为？」

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Mh... umm, beh. ..."

Speaker: {f:5:Virgilia}
Steam (ST): "...There's a single large difference between you and that child. That child may already be a witch. Of course, you are also a witch. ...At least, in the world on top of the game board."
Umineko Project (UP): "...There is a single large difference between you and that child. That child may already be a witch. Of course, you are also a witch. In the world on top of the game board."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...This is a single large difference between you and that child. That child may already be a witch. Of course, you are also a witch. In the world on top of the game board.
PC Japanese (JP): 「…あなたには、あの子と大きな違いがひとつあります。あの子はすでに魔女かもしれない。もちろんあなたも魔女です。ゲーム盤の上の世界では。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…あなたには、あの子と大きな違いがひとつあります。あの子はすでに魔女かもしれない。もちろんあなたも魔女です。ゲーム盤の上の世界では」
Russian (RU): "...Это и есть одно, но внушительное отличие между тобой и этим ребёнком. Это дитя, может, уже и ведьма. Разумеется, ты также являешься ведьмой. В мире на вершине игровой доски."

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…你與那孩子，有一個巨大的不同點。那孩子或許已是魔女。當然，你也是魔女。在這棋盤上的世界是。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…你与那孩子，有一个巨大的不同点。那孩子或许已是魔女。当然，你也是魔女。在这棋盘上的世界是。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Questa è una sola grande differenza tra te e lei. Quella ragazzina può essere già una strega. Ovviamente, anche tu lo sei. Nel mondo in cima a questo tavolo da gioco.

Speaker: {f:5:Virgilia}
Steam (ST): "...However, to be acknowledged as a witch in the world outside the game board, you need to have Battler-kun, your opponent in this game, acknowledge you. ...You must have understood that when you started the game."
Umineko Project (UP): "......However, to be accepted as a witch outside the game board, you need to have your opponent in this game, Battler‐kun, accept you. ......You must have understood that when you started the game."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......However, to be accepted as a witch outside the game board, you need to have your opponent in this game, Battler-kun, accept you. ......You must have understood that when you started the game."
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、ゲーム盤の外の世界で魔女だと認められるには、ゲームの対戦者である戦人くんに認めてもらわなくてはならない。……あなたはそれを理解してゲームを始めたはずです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……しかし、ゲーム盤の外の世界で魔女だと認められるには、ゲームの対戦者である戦人くんに認めてもらわなくてはならない。……あなたはそれを理解してゲームを始めたはずです」
Russian (RU): "......Однако чтобы оказаться принятой в качестве ведьмы вне игровой доски, тебе нужно, чтобы твой противник в этой игре, Баттлер‐кун, принял тебя. ......Ты наверняка поняла это, когда начала игру."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Porém, para ser aceita como uma bruxa fora do tabuleiro, você precisa fazer com que seu oponente neste jogo, o Battler‐kun, a aceite. ......Você devia ter entendido isso quando começou o jogo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……可是，在棋盤外的世界，要被承認為魔女，是必須得到遊戲敵手戰人君的承認的。……你應該是清楚這點，才開始的遊戲的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……可是，在棋盘外的世界，要被承认为魔女，是必须得到游戏敌手战人君的承认的。……你应该是清楚这点，才开始的游戏的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Tuttavia, per essere accettata come strega al di fuori di esso, tu hai bisogno che il tuo avversario in questo gioco, Battler-kun, ti accetti. ... Devi averlo capito quando hai iniziato la partita."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...I thought that if I could show off a whirlwind of proof that I am a witch, blow away his desire to deny me, and make him surrender, ......he would acknowledge me as a witch. ...It all went my way last time, so I thought I was just a breath away..."
Umineko Project (UP): "......I thought that if I could show off a whirlwind of proof that I am a witch, blow away his feelings that made him deny me, and break him completely, .........he would accept me as a witch. ...It all went my way last time, so I thought I was just a breath away..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......I thought that if I could show off a whirlwind of proof that I am a witch, blow away his feelings that made him deny me, and make him surrender, .........he would accept me as a witch. ...It all went my way last time, so I thought I was just a breath away..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……魔女である証拠を暴風のように見せつけ、妾を拒否する気持ちを吹き飛ばし屈服させれば、………妾を魔女と認めると思った。…前回、うまく行き掛けたので、もう一息だと思ったのだ…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……魔女である証拠を暴風のように見せつけ、妾を拒否する気持ちを吹き飛ばし屈服させれば、………妾を魔女と認めると思った。…前回、うまく行き掛けたので、もう一息だと思ったのだ…」
Russian (RU): "......Я думала, что если смогу покрасоваться в урагане доказательств того, что я ведьма, прогнать чувства, заставляющие его отрицать меня и вынудить его сдаться... То он примет меня как ведьму. ...В прошлый раз всё шло по‐моему и до цели оставалось всего ничего..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Pensei que se eu conseguisse exibir um redemoinho como prova de que sou uma bruxa, soprar os sentimentos dele que o faziam me negar, e quebrá‐lo completamente, .........ele me aceitaria como uma bruxa. ...Foi tudo do meu jeito da última vez, então pensei que eu estava só a um fio de cabelo de distância..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……妾身以為，如暴風般地亮出吾為魔女的證據，刮跑他否定妾身的念頭，令其屈服，………就會承認妾身是魔女了。…由於上一盤進展順利，所以還以為，就只差一口氣了…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……妾身以为，如暴风般地亮出吾为魔女的证据，刮跑他否定妾身的念头，令其屈服，………就会承认妾身是魔女了。…由于上一盘进展顺利，所以还以为，就只差一口气了…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Io pensavo che se gli avessi mostrato un vortice di prove del fatto che sono una strega, spazzato via i suoi sentimenti che lo spingevano a negarmi, e l'avessi fatto arrendere... lui mi avrebbe accettato come strega. ... Era andato tutto bene l'ultima volta, quindi ho pensato che mi mancasse così poco..."

Speaker: {f:5:Virgilia}
Steam (ST): "It's actually the opposite. Battler-kun was disgusted by your brutality. He did not step up to the plate as a player because he acknowledged you as a worthy opponent. It was based on a strong animosity, his resolve to completely deny the existence of a brutal witch."
Umineko Project (UP): "It's actually the opposite. Battler‐kun was shocked by your brutality. And the reason he stepped up as your opponent was not because he accepted you as an equal opponent. It was based on a strong animosity, as he tried to completely deny the existence of a brutal witch."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It's actually the opposite. Battler-kun was shocked by your brutality. And he did not step up to the plate as a game opponent simply because he accepted you as an equal opponent. It was based on a strong animosity, as he tried to completely deny the existence of a brutal witch."
PC Japanese (JP): 「実際は逆です。戦人くんはあなたの残忍さに呆れ果てていました。そしてゲームの対戦者として登壇したのは、あなたを対等な対戦相手だと認めたからではない。残忍な魔女の存在を一切認めないという強い敵意に基づいてです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「実際は逆です。戦人くんはあなたの残忍さに呆れ果てていました。そしてゲームの対戦者として登壇したのは、あなたを対等な対戦相手だと認めたからではない。残忍な魔女の存在を一切認めないという強い敵意に基づいてです」
Russian (RU): "А на деле получилось наоборот. Баттлер‐кун оказался шокирован твоей жестокостью. И он не потому взял на себя ответственность быть твоим противником в игре, что принял тебя в качестве равной противницы. Им двигала сильная злоба и неприязнь, и он пытался полностью отрицать существование жестокой ведьмы."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Na verdade, é o oposto. O Battler‐kun ficou abismado pela sua brutalidade.{n}E a razão que ele subiu como seu oponente não foi porque ele lhe aceitava como uma oponente igual. Foi baseado em uma forte animosidade, enquanto ele tentava negar completamente a existência de uma bruxa brutal."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「實際上正相反。戰人君對你的殘酷愕然到了極點。而且，他站到了遊戲敵手的位置上，並不是因為承認你為對等的對戰敵手。而是基於“一丁點都不會承認殘忍魔女的存在”的強烈敵意。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「实际上正相反。战人君对你的残酷愕然到了极点。而且，他站到了游戏敌手的位置上，并不是因为承认你为对等的对战敌手。而是基于“一丁点都不会承认残忍魔女的存在”的强烈敌意。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "In realtà è stato l'opposto. Battler-kun fu scioccato dalla tua malvagità. {n}E non aveva accettato la sfida come tuo avversario perché ti aveva accettata come suo pari. Si basava su una forte animosità, e provava a negare completamente l'esistenza di una strega brutale."

Speaker: {f:5:Virgilia}
Steam (ST): "......In your foolishness, you probably felt that Battler-kun's acceptance of his role as your opponent was a first step towards making him acknowledge you as a witch. However, it was actually the opposite."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........In your foolishness, you probably felt that Battler‐kun considering himself as your opponent...was a first step towards making him accept that you are a witch. However, it was actually the exact opposite."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........In your foolishness, you probably felt that Battler-kun's self-awareness as your opponent was a first step towards making him accept that you are a witch. However, it was actually the opposite."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………愚かなあなたは、戦人くんが対戦者の自覚を持ってくれたことを、自分を魔女だと認めさせる第一歩のように感じていたのでしょう。でも、実際はまったくの逆。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………愚かなあなたは、戦人くんが対戦者の自覚を持ってくれたことを、自分を魔女だと認めさせる第一歩のように感じていたのでしょう。でも、実際はまったくの逆」
Russian (RU): ".........В своей неразумности, ты наверняка воспринимала осознание Баттлером‐куном того, что он твой противник, как первый шаг к вынуждению его признать тебя ведьмой. На самом же деле, однако, всё было совсем наоборот."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Em sua tolice, você provavelmente sentiu que o fato do Battler‐kun considerar‐se seu oponente...era um primeiro passo em direção a fazê‐lo aceitar que você é uma bruxa. Porém, na verdade, era o exato oposto."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………愚蠢的你，是從戰人君自認自己是對局敵手的這點上，感受到了，這就猶如令其承認自己是魔女的第一步吧。但是，實際上完全相反。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………愚蠢的你，是从战人君自认自己是对局敌手的这点上，感受到了，这就犹如令其承认自己是魔女的第一步吧。但是，实际上完全相反。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Nella tua stupidità, probabilmente hai pensato che la consapevolezza di sé che aveva Battler-kun come tuo avversario... fosse un primo passo verso fargli accettare che tu fossi una strega. Tuttavia, era in realtà l'opposto."

Speaker: {f:5:Virgilia}
Steam (ST): "Battler-kun challenged you in this game because he was absolutely determined not to acknowledge you. ...No matter how hard the thoughtless north wind blows, the traveler only wears his cloak even tighter. You were committing a huge error from the very beginning."
Umineko Project (UP): "Battler‐kun challenged you in this game because he definitely would not accept you as a witch. ......No matter how much the thoughtless north wind blew, the traveler only wore his cloak even tighter. You were committing a huge error from the very beginning."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Battler-kun challenged you in this game because he definitely wouldn't accept you as a witch. ......No matter how much the thoughtless north wind blew, the traveler only wore his cloak even tighter. You were committing a huge error from the very beginning."
PC Japanese (JP): 「戦人くんは、あなたを魔女だと絶対に認めないために、あなたのゲームに挑んだのです。……浅はかな北風がいくら吹きつけようと、旅人はマントをより深く着込むだけ。あなたは大きな間違いを最初から犯しているのです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「戦人くんは、あなたを魔女だと絶対に認めないために、あなたのゲームに挑んだのです。……浅はかな北風がいくら吹きつけようと、旅人はマントをより深く着込むだけ。あなたは大きな間違いを最初から犯しているのです」
Russian (RU): "Баттлер‐кун бросил тебе вызов в этой игре, потому что определённо не желал принимать тебя как ведьму. ......Как бы сильно не дул северный ветер, путешественник лишь сильнее кутался в плащ. Ты упорствовала в совершении огромной ошибки с самого начала."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O Battler‐kun a desafiou neste jogo porque ele definitivamente não a aceitaria como uma bruxa. ......Não importa o quanto o imprudente o vento norte soprasse, o viajante apenas vestia seu manto ainda mais apertado. Você estava cometendo um erro enorme desde o início."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「戰人君是為了絕對不承認你為魔女，才在挑戰你的遊戲的。……不管淺薄的北風刮得多大，旅人都只會將披風裹得更緊。你在一開始，就犯下了巨大的錯誤。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「战人君是为了绝对不承认你为魔女，才在挑战你的游戏的。……不管浅薄的北风刮得多大，旅人都只会将披风裹得更紧。你在一开始，就犯下了巨大的错误。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Battler-kun ti ha sfidato in questo gioco perché lui di sicuro non ti avrebbe accettato come strega. ... Non importa quanto forte soffi il vento del nord, il viaggiatore semplicemente si avvolgerà ancora più stretto il mantello. Tu stavi commettendo un grande errore sin dall'inizio."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Steam (ST): "...All kids get their heads filled with innocent but cruel ideas sometimes. When I was young, I'd sometimes go around steppin' on ants and pullin' the wings off dragonflies. ......However, I learned the importance of life, and graduated from that cruel childhood age."
Umineko Project (UP): "...Everyone fills their head sometimes with innocent yet cruel fantasies, as kids. Even me, when I was young, I'd sometimes go around steppin' on ants and pullin' the wings off dragonflies. .........But you learn the importance of life, and grow out of that cruel childhood age."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...When they're children, anyone's head might be filled with innocent yet cruel delusions sometimes. When I was young, I'd sometimes go around steppin' on ants and pullin' the wings off dragonflies. .........However, I learned the importance of life, and graduated from that cruel childhood age.

Russian (RU): "...В детстве голова любого человека порой может быть полна невинных, и в то же время жестоких иллюзий, маний и несбыточных мечтаний. Когда я был маленьким мальчиком, я иногда наступал на муравьёв и отрывал крылышки у стрекоз. .........Однако я познал важность жизни и вырос из этого жестокого детского возраста."

PC Japanese (JP): ……あんたしつこいから、第六の晩の生贄に変更してあげるわ。…どこかのベッドの下に隠れて震えてでもいたなら、見逃してやるつもりだったのに。……わざわざ戻ってきて。本当に馬鹿な男だわ。」

Russian (RU): "......Ты меня достал, так что будешь жертвой шестых сумерек. ...Если бы спрятался под кроватью, трясясь от страха, я бы тебя отпустила. ......Вернувшись, ты сам напросился. И правда, что за недоумок."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Você é um saco, então mudarei o sacrifício do sexto crepúsculo para você. ...Se você só ficasse escondido debaixo de uma cama tremendo ou algo assim, eu tinha planejado deixá‐lo ir. ......Você voltou deliberadamente. Você realmente é um homem estúpido."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……因为你太烦了，所以将你变更成第六晚的活祭。…要是你随便找个床，躲在下面瑟瑟发抖的话，就放过你了。……竟专程回来。真是个笨男人。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Sei un fastidio, quindi varrai tu sacrificio del sesto crepuscolo. ... E se ti fossi semplicemente nascosto sotto un letto tremando o qualcosa del genere, ti avrei lasciato andare. ... Ti sei preso la briga di tornare indietro. Sei davvero un uomo stupido."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Tunk... Houve um som pesado enquanto Hideyoshi caía sobre o piso.

Steam (ST): Even though death would have allowed him to escape from that pain, he resisted until the last second, and staring straight into the witch's eyes, ...he passed away.
Umineko Project (UP): Even though he would be able to escape his pain by dying, he resisted that until the last second, and staring straight into the witch's eyes, ...he passed away.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though he would have been able to escape that pain when he died, he resisted until the last second, and staring straight into the witch's eyes, ...he passed away.
PC Japanese (JP): 死ねばその苦痛から逃れられるのに、最後の一秒までそれを拒み、魔女の目をじっと見つめ、…息絶えた。
Russian (RU): Хотя он мог убежать от этой боли после смерти, он боролся до последней секунды, глядя ведьме прямо в глаза и скончался.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo que ele fosse capaz de escapar dessa dor morrendo, ele resistiu àquilo até o último segundo e, encarando direto nos olhos da bruxa, ...ele faleceu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 死了就能逃過這份痛楚了，可他直至最後一秒，都在拒絕著死亡，直盯盯地盯著魔女的眼睛，…斷了氣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 死了就能逃过这份痛楚了，可他直至最后一秒，都在拒绝着死亡，直盯盯地盯着魔女的眼睛，…断了气。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Nonostante fosse stato capace di scappare al dolore della morte, lui resistette fino all'ultimo secondo, e fissando dritta negli occhi la strega... spirò.

Steam (ST): Because he had died without closing his eyes, the witch didn't realize that he was dead for a short while... and remained pinned by that gaze.
Umineko Project (UP): Because he had died without closing his eyes, for a short while, the witch didn't realize that he was dead, and she remained pinned down by that gaze.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because he had died without closing his eyes, the witch didn't realize that he was dead for a short while, and remained pinned down by that gaze.
PC Japanese (JP): 目を閉じずに死んだ為、しばらくの間、魔女は絶命したことに気付けずにいて、その眼差しに射抜かれたままでいるのだった。
Russian (RU): Поскольку он умер, не закрыв глаза, ведьма некоторое время не понимала, что он мёртв и оставалась пригвождённая его взглядом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porque ele tinha morrido sem fechar seus olhos, por um curto momento, a bruxa não percebeu que ele estava morto, e permaneceu pregada por aquele olhar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 由於他至死都沒有閉眼，所以魔女沒發覺他已經斃命了，被他的眼神盯得出神了好一會兒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 由于他至死都没有闭眼，所以魔女没发觉他已经毙命了，被他的眼神盯得出神了好一会儿。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dato che era morto senza aver chiuso i suoi occhi, la strega per un po' non realizzò che fosse morto, e rimase paralizzata da quello sguardo.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 煉獄七姐妹有個小小的榮耀。這即是指，剜入自己親手解決掉的獵物的，作為獵人的自豪。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 炼狱七姐妹有个小小的荣耀。这即是指，剜入自己亲手解决掉的猎物的，作为猎人的自豪。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Le Sette Sorelle del Purgatorio avevano un modesto senso di orgoglio. L'orgoglio in un cacciatore, l'orgoglio di perforare le prede che avevano loro stesse cacciato.

Steam (ST): ...However, being told to gouge a corpse that someone else had brought down ran contrary to that sentiment. Of course, the witch didn't mean it that way, but for the Seven Sisters, it was horribly humiliating.
Umineko Project (UP): ...However, being told to gouge a corpse that someone else had brought down ran contrary to that feeling. Of course, that was not the witch's intention, but for the Seven Sisters, it was horribly humiliating.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …しかし、他者が仕留めた死体を抉れというのはそれに反する。もちろん魔女にその意図はなかったが、七姉妹たちにとっては酷く屈辱的なことだった。
Russian (RU): ...Однако пронзание трупов, которые были убиты кем‐то другим, расходилось с этим чувством. Разумеется, это не входило в намерения ведьмы, но для семи сестёр такое действие было до ужаса унизительным.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Porém, ter de goivar um cadáver que alguém mais tinha abatido corria contrário a esse sentimento. É claro, essa não era a intenção da bruxa, mas para as Sete Irmãs, era horrivelmente humilhante.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …而讓她們剜他人解決的屍體，正與此背道而馳。當然，魔女並沒有這個意圖，不過對七姐妹來說，這就是個無上的屈辱。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …而让她们剜他人解决的尸体，正与此背道而驰。当然，魔女并没有这个意图，不过对七姐妹来说，这就是个无上的屈辱。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Tuttavia, dir loro di perforare un cadavere che qualcun altro aveva abbattuto si poneva in contrasto con quel sentimento. Ovviamente, questa non era l'intenzione della strega, ma per le Sette Sorelle era terribilmente umiliante.

Steam (ST): ...However, they had already screwed this up, with two of the Sisters defeated, so they had no right to question her.
Umineko Project (UP): ...However, they had already messed up, with two of the sisters defeated, so they had no right to question her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …しかし、姉妹の２人が敗れるという失態をすでに犯しており、それを言い返す資格はなかった。
Russian (RU): ...Однако они уже дали маху, и две из них оказались побеждены, так что у неё не было права хоть как‐то возражать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Porém, elas já tinham falhado, com duas das irmãs derrotadas, então não tinham direito de questioná‐la.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不過，已犯下姐妹兩人戰敗的失態，就沒資格還口了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …不过，已犯下姐妹两人战败的失态，就没资格还口了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Tuttavia, loro avevano già causato problemi, con due di loro sconfitte, quindi non avevano il diritto di obiettare.

Steam (ST): Only Ronove appreciated this, and he rested his hand on her shoulder in understanding.
Umineko Project (UP): Only Ronove appreciated that, and he rested his hand on her shoulder in understanding.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Only Ronove appreciated that, and he rested his hand on her shoulder in understanding.
PC Japanese (JP): ロノウェだけがそれを汲み取り、察するように肩に手を載せる。
Russian (RU): Лишь Ронове морально поддержал её, понимающе положив руку ей на плечо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Apenas Ronove apreciou aquilo, e descansou sua mão no ombro dela em entendimento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 僅是羅諾威一人想到了這點，像是體諒她似的，把手放到了她的肩上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 仅是罗诺威一人想到了这点，像是体谅她似的，把手放到了她的肩上。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Solo Ronove se ne rese conto, e poggiò la sua mano sulla spalla di lei come gesto di comprensione.

Speaker: Ronove
Steam (ST): "...This is an order from {f:5:Beatrice}-sama. Lucifer, carry these three and dispose of them in accordance with the etiquette of the ceremony. Then, when you are done, lend me a hand with the cleanup."
Umineko Project (UP): "......It is {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama's order. Lucifer, carry the three, and deal with them according to the protocol of the ritual. Then, when you are done, lend me a hand with the cleanup."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......It is Beatrice-sama's order. Lucifer, carry the three, and deal with them according to the etiquette of the ceremony. Then, when you are done, lend me a hand with the cleanup."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……ベアトリーチェさまのご命令ですよ。ルシファーは３人を選び、儀式の作法に従い処理をするように。あと、できましたら私のお片付けにも手を貸してください。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……ベアトリーチェさまのご命令ですよ。ルシファーは３人を選び、儀式の作法に従い処理をするように。あと、できましたら私のお片付けにも手を貸してください」
Russian (RU): "......Таков приказ {f:5:Беатриче}‐сама. Люцифер, займись этими тремя и действуй в соответствии с этикетом ритуала. А когда закончишь, предоставь мне разбираться с уборкой."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......É a ordem da {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama. Lucifer, carregue os três e lide com eles de acordo com o protocolo do ritual. Então, quando você terminar, me dê uma mão com a limpeza."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……這是貝阿朵莉切夫人的命令。路西法選出三人，按照儀式規矩處理。另外，等做完後，就請來幫我收拾吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……这是贝阿朵莉切夫人的命令。路西法选出三人，按照仪式规矩处理。另外，等做完后，就请来帮我收拾吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... È l'ordine di Beatrice-sama. Lucifer, porta loro tre, e occupatene secondo il rituale della cerimonia. Poi, quando hai finito, dammi una mano con la pulizia."

Umineko Project (UP): "Certainly......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「畏まりました……。」
Russian (RU): "Разумеется......"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Certamente......"
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Certamente..."

Steam (ST): The witch looked down upon Hideyoshi's corpse, as though implying that the now delicate atmosphere was all Hideyoshi's fault.
Umineko Project (UP): The witch looked down upon Hideyoshi's corpse, as though implying that this somehow weird atmosphere was all Hideyoshi's fault.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The witch looked down upon Hideyoshi's corpse, as though implying that the now delicate atmosphere was all Hideyoshi's fault.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女は、何となく微妙になった空気は、全て秀吉のせいだとでも言いたげにその死体を見下ろす。
Russian (RU): Ведьма взглянула на труп Хидэёши, словно подразумевая, что установившаяся в холле атмосфера деликатности была его виной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A bruxa olhou para baixo, sobre o cadáver de Hideyoshi, como que implicando que este clima de alguma forma estranho era tudo culpa de Hideyoshi.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 猶如在說，這多少變得微妙的氣氛，全是秀吉的錯似的，魔女望向他的屍體。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 犹如在说，这多少变得微妙的气氛，全是秀吉的错似的，魔女望向他的尸体。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La strega guardò dall'alto in basso il cadavere di Hideyoshi, come per implicare che quella scottante atmosfera era tutta colpa di quell'uomo.

Speaker: {f:5:Eva Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "......Stupid man. And you didn't even have to die."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Stupid man. You didn't even have to die."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Stupid man. And you didn't even have to die."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………馬鹿な男ね。死なずに済んだのに。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………馬鹿な男ね。死なずに済んだのに」
Russian (RU): ".........Глупец. А ведь тебе было необязательно умирать."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Homem estúpido. Você nem tinha que morrer."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………愚蠢的男人。明明能逃過一死。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………愚蠢的男人。明明能逃过一死。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Stupido uomo. E non dovevi neanche morire."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Steam (ST): "Dear...!!! Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhh!! Dear, where are you?! You're there, right? Answer me!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Honey......!!! Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhh!! Honey, where are you?! You're there, right? Answer me!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Dear......!!! Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhh!! Dear, where are you?! You're there, right? Answer me!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「あなた……ッ！！！　あああぁあああぁああぁあぁ！！　あなた、どこ？！　いるわよね？　返事をしてッ！！」
Russian (RU): "Дорогой!!! А‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а‐а!!! Дорогой, где ты?! Ты же здесь, так? Отзовись!!!"

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「老公……！！！啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊！！老公，你在哪兒？！在吧？回答一聲！！」

Umineko Project (UP): The sound of a loud thunderbolt woke Eva from her nightmare.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 大きな落雷の音が、絵羽の悪夢を覚ます。
Russian (RU): Громкий звук удара молнии пробудил Еву от жуткого кошмара.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O som de um trovão barulhento acordou Eva de seu pesadelo.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 巨大的雷声，令绘羽从噩梦中醒来了。

Steam (ST): If Hideyoshi had been gripping her hand at that time, her fearful heart would probably have been instantly healed.
Umineko Project (UP): If Hideyoshi had been gripping her hand at that time, her fearful heart would probably have been instantly healed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If Hideyoshi had been gripping her hand at that time, her fearful heart would probably have been instantly healed.

Russian (RU): Если бы в этот момент Хидэёши сжимал её руку, её исполненное страха сердце наверняка бы моментально исцелилось.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se Hideyoshi estivesse agarrando a mão dela naquela hora, seu coração temeroso provavelmente teria sido curado instantaneamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如果此時，秀吉握著她的手的話，她驚恐的心當即就會恢復平靜吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如果此时，秀吉握着她的手的话，她惊恐的心当即就会恢复平静吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Se Hideyoshi le avesse afferrato la mano in quel momento, il suo cuore spaventato probabilmente sarebbe subito guarito.

Umineko Project (UP): However, Hideyoshi, who had sworn that he wouldn't leave even for a moment, was nowhere to be seen in the room.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, Hideyoshi, que tinha jurado que não a deixaria nem por um momento, não podia ser visto no quarto.
